verses.text: The preparations of the heart in man, And the answer of the tongue, \add is\add* from the \sc Lord\sc*.
All the ways of a man \add are\add* clean in his own eyes; But the \sc Lord\sc* weigheth the spirits.
Commit thy works unto the \sc Lord\sc*, And thy thoughts shall be established.
The \sc Lord\sc* hath made all \add things\add* for himself: Yea, even the wicked for the day of evil.
Every one \add that is\add* proud in heart \add is\add* an abomination to the \sc Lord\sc*: \add Though\add* hand \add join\add* in hand, he shall not be unpunished.
By mercy and truth iniquity is purged: And by the fear of the \sc Lord\sc* \add men\add* depart from evil.
When a man’s ways please the \sc Lord\sc*, He maketh even his enemies to be at peace with him.
Better \add is\add* a little with righteousness Than great revenues without right.
A man’s heart deviseth his way: But the \sc Lord\sc* directeth his steps.
A divine sentence \add is\add* in the lips of the king: His mouth transgresseth not in judgment.
A just weight and balance \add are\add* the \sc Lord’s\sc*: All the weights of the bag \add are\add* his work.
\add It is\add* an abomination to kings to commit wickedness: For the throne is established by righteousness.
Righteous lips \add are\add* the delight of kings; And \add they\add* love him that speaketh right.
The wrath of a king \add is as\add* messengers of death: But a wise man will pacify it.
In the light of the king’s countenance \add is\add* life; And his favour \add is\add* as a cloud of the latter rain.
How much better \add is it\add* to get wisdom than gold! And to get understanding rather to be chosen than silver!
The highway of the upright \add is\add* to depart from evil: He that keepeth his way preserveth his soul.
Pride \add goeth\add* before destruction, And a haughty spirit before a fall.
Better \add it is to be\add* of an humble spirit with the lowly, Than to divide the spoil with the proud.
He that handleth a matter wisely shall find good: And whoso trusteth in the \sc Lord\sc*, happy \add is\add* he.
The wise in heart shall be called prudent: And the sweetness of the lips increaseth learning.
Understanding \add is\add* a wellspring of life unto him that hath it: But the instruction of fools \add is\add* folly.
The heart of the wise teacheth his mouth, And addeth learning to his lips.
Pleasant words \add are as\add* a honeycomb, Sweet to the soul, and health to the bones.
There is a way that seemeth right unto a man, But the end thereof \add are\add* the ways of death.
He that laboureth laboureth for himself; For his mouth craveth it of him.
An ungodly man diggeth up evil: And in his lips \add there is\add* as a burning fire.
A froward man soweth strife: And a whisperer separateth chief friends.
A violent man enticeth his neighbour, And leadeth him into the way \add that is\add* not good.
He shutteth his eyes to devise froward things: Moving his lips he bringeth evil to pass.
The hoary head \add is\add* a crown of glory, \add If\add* it be found in the way of righteousness.
\add He that is\add* slow to anger \add is\add* better than the mighty; And he that ruleth his spirit than he that taketh a city.
The lot is cast into the lap; But the whole disposing thereof \add is\add* of the \sc Lord\sc*.
